comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: From Victorian Cartes-de-Visite by Carol Wichard, p 15, Osprey Publishing, 1999: "George W. Godfrey and Company of Main Street, Rochester, New York, cleverly adapted this 'gem' portrait (taken using Wing's Patent Multiplying Camera) to the carte-de-visite format. The portrait is held in a small brass preserver by two lugs which are stuck through the card mount and bent over to hold the image in place."
